item.title: Autumn add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Anyone who believes what a cat tells him deserves all he gets." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "If you are a dreamer come in If you are a dreamer a wisher a liar A hoper a pray-er a magic-bean-buyer If youre a pretender com sit by my fire For we have some flax golden tales to spin Come in! Come in!" -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Autumn add a quote by E. M. Forster
item.description: "She could not explain in so many words, but she felt that those who prepare for all the emergencies of life beforehand may equip themselves at the expense of joy." -- E. M. Forster

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Sometimes you wake up. Sometimes the fall kills you. And sometimes, when you fall, you fly." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Books are mirrors: you only see in them what you already have inside you." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I've been making a list of the things they don't teach you at school. They don't teach you how to love somebody. They don't teach you how to be famous. They don't teach you how to be rich or how to be poor. They don't teach you how to walk away from someone you don't love any longer. They don't teach you how to know what's going on in someone else's mind. They don't teach you what to say to someone who's dying. They don't teach you anything worth knowing." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Elizabeth Wein
item.description: "It's like being in love, discovering your best friend." -- Elizabeth Wein

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Gather out of star-dust, Earth-dust, Cloud-dust, Storm-dust, And splinters of hail, One handful of dream-dust, Not for sale." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Theodore Roethke
item.description: "What we need are more people who specialize in the impossible." -- Theodore Roethke

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "The secret of flight is this -- you have to do it immediately, before your body realizes it is defying the laws." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Laini Taylor
item.description:
"Once upon a time, an angel and a devil fell in love.
It did not end well." -- Laini Taylor

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Autumn Doughton
item.description: "I have serious issues with families in coordinated clothing. Just sayin" -- Autumn Doughton

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "Being a reader is sort of like being president, except reading involves fewer state dinners, usually. You have this agenda you want to get through, but you get distracted by life events, e.g., books arriving in the mail/World War III, and you are temporarily deflected from your chosen path." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "Books are, let's face it, better than everything else." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "A self is not something static, tied up in a pretty parcel and handed to the child, finished and complete. A self is always becoming." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Stefan Zweig
item.description: "Time to leave now, get out of this room, go somewhere, anywhere; sharpen this feeling of happiness and freedom, stretch your limbs, fill your eyes, be awake, wider awake, vividly awake in every sense and every pore." -- Stefan Zweig

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Autumn Doughton
item.description: "Happiness isn't something that you plan for. It comes knocking unexpectedly, just like opportunity. And it's up to you to answer the door and invite it inside." -- Autumn Doughton

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Books may well be the only true magic." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I have hated words and I have loved them, and I hope I have made them right." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Play it fuckin' loud!" -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "In your light I learn how to love. In your beauty, how to make poems. You dance inside my chest where no-one sees you, but sometimes I do, and that sight becomes this art." -- Rumi

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Barbara Taylor Bradford
item.description: "We are each the authors of our own lives, Emma. We live in what we have created. There is no way to shift the blame and no one else to accept the accolades." -- Barbara Taylor Bradford

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "Like stepping into a fairy tale under a curtain of stars." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Autumn Doughton
item.description: "Do you hear that sound? It's the sound of the world ripping apart." -- Autumn Doughton
